org.cougaar.core.adaptivity
Interface OperatingMode

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
InterAgentOperatingMode, OperatingModeCondition, OperatingModeImpl
public interface OperatingMode
extends java.io.Serializable

A control input for a component (for example, a plugin). The AdaptivityEngine sets OperatingMode values according to the plays it selects. OperatingModes are generally created by the component whose operation can be controlled. OperatingModes should be published to the blackboard so they are accessible to the OperatingModeServiceProvider. The component should also subscribe to the OperatingMode if it needs to know when changes occur. Alternatively, the value can be examined as needed.

Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Gets the (distinct) name of this OperatingMode. The names of all the OperatingMode on a particular blackboard must be distinct. This can be achieved by establishing naming conventions such has including the class name of the plugin or other component in the name. Where the same component class may be instantiated multiple times, the multiple instances may already have some sor of name that can be used in addition to the class name. It is the responsibility of the component designer to insure that OperatingMode names are not ambiguous.

Returns:
the name of this OperatingMode

getAllowedValues

OMCRangeList getAllowedValues()
Get the list of allowed value ranges for this OperatingMode. Attempts to set the value outside these ranges will fail.

Returns:
a list of allowed value ranges

getValue

java.lang.Comparable getValue()
Get the current value of this OperatingMode. This value must never be outside the allowed value ranges.

Returns:
the current value of this OperatingMode

setValue

void setValue(java.lang.Comparable newValue)
Set a new value for this OperatingMode. Used by the AdaptivityEngine to alter the mode of the component having this OperatingMode.

Parameters:
newValue - the new value for this OperatingMode. Must be in the allowed value ranges.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the newValue is not allowed.
